title: R.I. college student dies of carbon monoxide poisoning while charging cellphone in car
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Joseph Boutros, 21, a student at Salve Regina University, died from carbon monoxide poisoning while charging his phone in an idling car.
Boutros was found unconscious in a parked vehicle on Bellevue Avenue, with the exhaust pipe embedded in snow, during a nor'easter in Newport.
Newport police state the incident was accidental, highlighting the importance of keeping exhaust pipes clear of snow when vehicles are idling.

title: Mass. hiker suffering medical emergency rescued from White Mountains
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 75-year-old hiker from Acton, Massachusetts, was rescued from Zealand Hut in White Mountains after a medical emergency.
New Hampshire Fish and Game responded at 2 a.m. Sunday; hiker assisted 2.2 miles down trail to meet rescue team.
Hiker transported by snowmobile to Route 3, then by ambulance to Littleton Regional Hospital for further treatment.

title: Man arrested for allegedly throwing dog off balcony while drunk in Milford
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A Milford man, Alex De Oliveira, 25, allegedly threw a dog off a balcony while intoxicated.
Police found the injured dog partially buried in snow outside Oak Ridge Apartments and provided aid.
De Oliveira was charged with animal cruelty, disturbing the peace, and released on $5,000 bail.

title: 5 takeaways from Eliot Wolf’s press conference at the NFL Scouting Combine
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Eliot Wolf discussed Patriots' offseason priorities at the NFL Scouting Combine in Indianapolis.
Wolf denied interest in Green Bay left tackle Rasheed Walker amid playoff concerns for Will Campbell.
No specific plans for Stefon Diggs were shared; his contract status remains undecided.

title: Mass. girl, 11, killed in Utah avalanche while vacationing with family
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: 11-year-old Madelyn Eitas from Rochester died in a Utah avalanche near Brighton Ski Resort while on a family vacation.
Greater Salt Lake police and Eitas's family conducted a rescue operation after being alerted to an avalanche at 'Rock Garden'.
Rochester community, including local schools and youth soccer programs, mourns Eitas's death, offering support and tributes to her memory.

title: Dorchester women injured after snowmobile hits multiple trees in N.H.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Two Dorchester women were injured in a snowmobile crash near Fish Pond in Columbia, New Hampshire, on Friday.
The crash occurred when a first-time operator lost control, hitting trees after navigating from a plowed road onto a trail.
Both women were transported to Upper Connecticut Valley Hospital after emergency services used an Argo vehicle for extraction.

title: Frederick Wiseman, the Bostonian who changed filmmaking forever
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Frederick Wiseman, acclaimed documentary filmmaker from Boston, has died at 96.
Wiseman's breakthrough film 'Titicut Follies' was banned in Massachusetts for over 20 years.
His films, including 'Welfare' and 'City Hall,' are known for their slow, contemplative style.

title: Layoffs hit Boston Metal as company plans Woburn shutdown
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Boston Metal to cut 71 jobs and close all Woburn facilities starting March 14.
An industrial accident in Brazil halted operations, impacting Boston Metal's financing deal.
Company plans to focus on restoring operations in Brazil and scaling metals business internationally.

title: Travelers, did you get stranded due to the blizzard?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Nearly 1,000 flights were cancelled at Logan Airport due to a blizzard in the region.
The blizzard resulted in over 3 feet of snow, high winds, and power outages across New England.
Amtrak suspended service between Boston and New York, and a travel ban was issued for Massachusetts' south coast.

title: Boston Legacy FC announces New Kids on the Block halftime show for home opener
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston Legacy FC announces New Kids on the Block will perform at their inaugural home opener halftime on March 14.
The home opener match against NJ/NY Gotham FC will be held at Gillette Stadium and is expected to draw a historic crowd.
Over 20,000 tickets sold so far for the event, combining soccer with New Kids on the Block's iconic hits during halftime.
